original: Hultin, Torsten, hamnöveringenjör, Göteborg, f. 9/10/85 i Mölndal av pastorn o. skolförest. Gustaf H. o. Jenny Carlberg. G. 15 m. Maja Ekman. Barn: Inga f. 16, g. m. polisman Arne Berglin, Gravarne, Lars 20, civ :ing., Gbg, Maja-Stina 23, g. m. apot. Gunnar Wetterqvist, Gbg, Sven 25, tek-nol., Hans 26, stud., Britta 29, Mats 31. — Mog:ex. v. Gbgs h. latin 05, utex. fr. CTL (VoV) 09. Bitr. ing. v. Gbgs hamnstyr. nybyggn :avd. 09-17, arb:chef där 18-20, ritkont :chef 20-43, övering. sed. 43, ispec :lär. i vattenbyggn. v. CTH sed. 30. Led. av Lundby kyrkoråd sed. 21, kyrkvärd där sed. 29, led. av stadsfullm. (h) i Gbg samt led. av olika stadsfullm :-komm. 31-38, led. av folksk :styr. 31-34, av drätselkamm. andra avd. 34-41, v. ordf. där 38-41’, led. av kyrkondn sed. 36, v. ordf. i poliisndn sed. 41 o. i pens :ndn sed. 30. Sekr. i Chalmers ing:£ören. 11-15, ordf. i Tekn. samf. avd. f. väg- o. vattenbyggn. 42-43, led. av Sv. tekn:fören. o. Sv. komm:tekn. fören. Skr.: Metod f. beräkn. av pål-belastning (Ii), Bidrag t. känned. om friktionspålars bärighet (28), Om influenslinjer f. pålbelastningar (29) m. fl. upps. i fackpubl. RVO.
translated: Hultin, Torsten, port engineer, Gothenburg, born on October 9, 1885 in Mölndal to the pastor and school principal Gustaf H. and Jenny Carlberg. Married to Maja Ekman. Children: Inga, born in 1916, married to policeman Arne Berglin, Gravarne; Lars, born in 1920, civil engineer, Gothenburg; Maja-Stina, born in 1917, married to pharmacist Gunnar Wetterqvist, Gothenburg; Sven, born in 1915, technologist; Hans, born in 1914, student; Britta, born in 1911, Mats, born in 1909. Graduated from Gothenburg Higher Latin School in 1905, and Centrala Tekniska Läroverket (VoV) in 1909. Assistant engineer at Gothenburg Port's new construction department from 1909 to 1917, works manager from 1918 to 1920, head of the design department from 1920 to 1943, and port engineer since 1943. Inspector in water engineering at Chalmers University of Technology since 1930. Member of Lundby Parish Council since 1921, churchwarden since 1929, member of Gothenburg City Council (Conservative Party) and member of various committees from 1931 to 1938, member of the school board from 1931 to 1934, member of the finance committee's second division from 1934 to 1941, vice chairman from 1938 to 1941, member of the Church Board since 1936, vice chairman of the Police Board since 1941 and of the Pension Board since 1930. Secretary of the Chalmers Engineers' Association from 1911 to 1915, chairman of the Technical Society's section for road and water engineering from 1942 to 1943, member of the Swedish Engineering Association and the Swedish Municipal Engineering Association. Published papers on the calculation of pile loads, the bearing capacity of friction piles, and the influence lines for pile loads, among others, in professional journals of the Royal Swedish Academy of Engineering Sciences.

affiliation.affiliation: Technical Society's Section for Road and Water Engineering
